Posted By: supershawn (6/14/2011 2:51:43 PM)

posts.post_content:
People have mentioned combo potential a lot already (I use one of these in my casual [Act of Treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Treason)/[Bazaar Trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bazaar Trader) hijacker deck) but it's not really a strong enough combo to build a deck around. If you don't have other ways to keep pressure on the opponent they'll just keep it and deal with the damage.  
  
Although as far as combos go, another decent one is a token generator like [Awakening Zone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Awakening Zone), and adding [Mortician Beetle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mortician Beetle) to the mix isn't bad.
posts.html:
People have mentioned combo potential a lot already (I use one of these in my casual Act of Treason/Bazaar Trader hijacker deck) but it's not really a strong enough combo to build a deck around. If you don't have other ways to keep pressure on the opponent they'll just keep it and deal with the damage.

Although as far as combos go, another decent one is a token generator like Awakening Zone, and adding Mortician Beetle to the mix isn't bad.

posts.post_content: If you have [Magma Phoenix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magma Phoenix) on the field then you probably have access to at least 4 mana the next turn. Drop this, sac the Phoenix and cast [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm). Your opponent takes 3 and hopefully you can manufacture a board wipe or at least wipe anything your opponent would have been okay with sacing just to save themselves 2 damage. Beginning of their upkeep and this make 5 damage and a board wipe from about 4 mana.
posts.html:

Posted By: monkeymonk42 (8/30/2011 7:42:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: To me, the cost of its activated ability is as interesting as its effect. Outside of black, I don't think there's another standard-legal card that just lets you sacrifice creatures w/o an additional cost (such as tapping). Keep in mind that you can pay its cost several times before its effect resolves, given how the stack works. Practical applications for this include [Viridian Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viridian Emissary), [Perilous Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perilous Myr), or large-scale shenanigans with [Nim Deathmantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nim Deathmantle) :)
posts.html:
To me, the cost of its activated ability is as interesting as its effect. Outside of black, I don't think there's another standard-legal card that just lets you sacrifice creatures w/o an additional cost (such as tapping). Keep in mind that you can pay its cost several times before its effect resolves, given how the stack works. Practical applications for this include Viridian Emissary, Perilous Myr, or large-scale shenanigans with Nim Deathmantle :)
